justification: The article consistently uses looking time to measure infants' and adults' habituation and dishabituation responses, referring to how long participants look at certain stimuli as a measure of their attentional decision-making.

topic_or_construct: perceptual and cognitive abilities of infants
justification: Developmental psychologists leverage infants' looking time to infer their perceptual and cognitive abilities, particularly through habituation and dishabituation paradigms.

measured_by: RATIONAL ACTION, Noisy Choice for Habituation (RANCH) model
justification: The RANCH model is used to predict and explain infant looking time changes in habituation and dishabituation tasks. It models looking behavior as a series of binary decisions based on expected information gain from perceptual samples.
